meanings.definition: semiworks (noun): Incomplete or unfinished works or projects.
meanings.sent1: The artist's studio was filled with semiworks waiting to be completed.
meanings.sent2: I have a pile of semiworks in my room that I need to finish.
meanings.sent3: The student's backpack was a jumble of semiworks, from half-done homework to sketches.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a gallery of semiworks, each piece holding a promise of completion.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a canvas of semiworks, with flowers in various stages of bloom.

meanings.definition: semiworks (verb): To partially complete or work on something.
meanings.sent1: I will semiworks on my essay tonight and finish it tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She semiworks on her painting every evening after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to semiworks on the recipe by adding a pinch of spice.
meanings.sent4: The team semiworks on the project, making progress bit by bit.
meanings.sent5: He semiworks on his car every weekend, fixing one part at a time.
